logic","methods":{"authorizeOperator(address)":{"details":"Set a third party operator address as an operator of 'msg.sender' to transfer and redeem tokens on its behalf.","params":{"operator":"Address to set as an operator for 'msg.sender'."}},"authorizeOperatorByPartition(bytes32,address)":{"details":"Set 'operator' as an operator for 'msg.sender' for a given partition.","params":{"operator":"Address to set as an operator for 'msg.sender'.","partition":"Name of the partition."}},"balanceOf(address)":{"details":"Get the balance of the account with address the balance is returned."},"return":"Amount of token of partition 'partition' held by 'tokenHolder' in the token contract."},"canOperatorTransferByPartition(bytes32,address,address,uint256,bytes,bytes)":{"details":"Know the reason on success or failure based on the EIP-1066 application-specific status codes.","params":{"data":"Information attached to the transfer. [CAN CONTAIN THE DESTINATION PARTITION]","from":"Token holder.","operatorData":"Information attached to the transfer, by the operator. [CONTAINS THE CONDITIONAL OWNERSHIP CERTIFICATE]","partition":"Name of the partition.","to":"Token recipient.","value":"Number of tokens to transfer."},"return":"ESC (Ethereum Status Code) following the EIP-1066 standard.Additional bytes32 parameter that can be used to define application specific reason codes with additional details (for example the transfer restriction rule responsible for making the transfer operation invalid).Destination partition."},"canTransferByPartition(bytes32,address,uint256,bytes)":{"details":"Know the reason on success or failure based on the EIP-1066 application-specific status codes.","params":{"data":"Information attached to the transfer, by the token holder. [CONTAINS THE CONDITIONAL OWNERSHIP CERTIFICATE]","partition":"Name of the partition.","to":"Token recipient.","value":"Number of tokens to transfer."},"return":"ESC (Ethereum Status Code) following the EIP-1066 standard.Additional bytes32 parameter that can be used to define application specific reason codes with additional details (for example the transfer restriction rule responsible for making the transfer operation invalid).Destination partition."},"certificateSigners(address)":{"details":"Get certificate signer authorization for an operator.","params":{"operator":"Address whom to check the certificate signer authorization for."},"return":"bool 'true' if operator is authorized as certificate signer, 'false' if not."},"checkCount(address)":{"details":"Get number of transations already sent to this contract by the sender","params":{"sender":"Address whom to check the counter of."},"return":"uint256 Number of transaction already sent to this contract."},"constructor":{"details":"Initialize ERC1400 + register the contract implementation in ERC820Registry.","params":{"certificateSigner":"Address of the off-chain service which signs the conditional ownership certificates required for token transfers, issuance, redemption (Cf. CertificateController.sol).","controllers":"Array of initial controllers.","granularity":"Granularity of the token.","name":"Name of the token.","symbol":"Symbol of the token."}},"controllers()":{"details":"Get the list of controllers as defined by the token contract.","return":"List of addresses of all the controllers."},"controllersByPartition(bytes32)":{"details":"Get controllers for a given partition. Function used for ERC777 and ERC20 backwards compatibility.","params":{"partition":"Name of the partition."},"return":"Array of controllers for partition."},"getDefaultPartitions(address)":{"details":"Get default partitions to transfer from. Function used for ERC777 and ERC20 backwards compatibility. For example, a security token may return the bytes32(\"unrestricted\").","params":{"tokenHolder":"Address for which we want to know the default partitions."},"return":"Array of default partitions."},"getDocument(bytes32)":{"details":"Access a document associated with the token.","params":{"name":"Short name (represented as a bytes32) associated to the document."},"return":"Requested document + document hash."},"getTokenDefaultPartitions()":{"details":"Get token default partitions to send from. Function used for ERC777 and ERC20 backwards compatibility. For example, a security token may return the bytes32(\"unrestricted\").","return":"Default partitions."},"granularity()":{"details":"Get the smallest part of the token that\u2019s not divisible.","return":"The smallest non-divisible part of the token."},"isControllable()":{"details":"Know if the token can be controlled by operators. If a token returns 'false' for 'isControllable()'' then it MUST always return 'false' in the future.","return":"bool 'true' if the token can still be controlled by operators, 'false' if it can't anymore."},"isIssuable()":{"details":"Know if new tokens can be issued in the future.","return":"bool 'true' if tokens can still be issued by the issuer, 'false' if they can't anymore."},"isOperatorFor(address,address)":{"details":"Indicate whether the operator address is an operator of the tokenHolder address.","params":{"operator":"Address which may be an operator of tokenHolder.","tokenHolder":"Address of a token holder which may have the operator address as an operator."},"return":"'true' if operator is an operator of 'tokenHolder' and 'false' otherwise."},"isOperatorForPartition(bytes32,address,address)":{"details":"Indicate whether the operator address is an operator of the tokenHolder address for the given partition.","params":{"operator":"Address which may be an operator of tokenHolder for the given partition.","partition":"Name of the partition.","tokenHolder":"Address of a token holder which may have the operator address as an operator for the given partition."},"return":"'true' if 'operator' is an operator of 'tokenHolder' for partition 'partition' and 'false' otherwise."},"isOwner()":{"return":"true if `msg.sender` is the owner of the contract."},"issueByPartition(bytes32,address,uint256,bytes)":{"details":"Issue tokens from a specific partition.","params":{"data":"Information attached to the issuance, by the issuer. [CONTAINS THE CONDITIONAL OWNERSHIP CERTIFICATE]","partition":"Name of the partition.","tokenHolder":"Address for which we want to issue tokens.","value":"Number of tokens issued."}},"name()":{"details":"Get the name of the token, e.g., \"MyToken\".","return":"Name of the token."},"operatorRedeemByPartition(bytes32,address,uint256,bytes,bytes)":{"details":"Redeem tokens of a specific partition.","params":{"data":"Information attached to the redemption.","operatorData":"Information attached to the redemption, by the operator. [CONTAINS THE CONDITIONAL OWNERSHIP CERTIFICATE]","partition":"Name of the partition.","tokenHolder":"Address for which we want to redeem tokens.","value":"Number of tokens redeemed."}},"operatorTransferByPartition(bytes32,address,address,uint256,bytes,bytes)":{"details":"Transfer tokens from a specific partition through an operator.","params":{"data":"Information attached to the transfer. [CAN CONTAIN THE DESTINATION PARTITION]","from":"Token holder.","operatorData":"Information attached to the transfer, by the operator. [CONTAINS THE CONDITIONAL OWNERSHIP CERTIFICATE]","partition":"Name of the partition.","to":"Token recipient.","value":"Number of tokens to transfer."},"return":"Destination partition."},"owner()":{"return":"the address of the owner."},"partitionsOf(address)":{"details":"Get partitions index of a tokenholder.","params":{"tokenHolder":"Address for which the partitions index are returned."},"return":"Array of partitions index of 'tokenHolder'."},"redeem(uint256,bytes)":{"details":"Redeem the value of tokens from the address 'msg.sender'.","params":{"data":"Information attached to the redemption, by the token holder. [CONTAINS THE CONDITIONAL OWNERSHIP CERTIFICATE]","value":"Number of tokens to redeem."}},"redeemByPartition(bytes32,uint256,bytes)":{"details":"Redeem tokens of a specific partition.","params":{"data":"Information attached to the redemption, by the redeemer. [CONTAINS THE CONDITIONAL OWNERSHIP CERTIFICATE]","partition":"Name of the partition.","value":"Number of tokens redeemed."}},"redeemFrom(address,uint256,bytes,bytes)":{"details":"Redeem the value of tokens on behalf of the address 'from'.","params":{"data":"Information attached to the redemption.","from":"Token holder whose tokens will be redeemed (or 'address(0)' to set from to 'msg.sender').","operatorData":"Information attached to the redemption, by the operator. [CONTAINS THE CONDITIONAL OWNERSHIP CERTIFICATE]","value":"Number of tokens to redeem."}},"renounceControl()":{"details":"Definitely renounce the possibility to control tokens on behalf of tokenHolders. Once set to false, '_isControllable' can never be set to 'true' again."},"renounceIssuance()":{"details":"Definitely renounce the possibility to issue new tokens. Once set to false, '_isIssuable' can never be set to 'true' again."},"renounceOwnership()":{"details":"Allows the current owner to relinquish control of the contract. It will not be possible to call the functions with the `onlyOwner` modifier anymore."},"revokeOperator(address)":{"details":"Remove the right of the operator address to be an operator for 'msg.sender' and to transfer and redeem tokens on its behalf.","params":{"operator":"Address to rescind as an operator for 'msg.sender'."}},"revokeOperatorByPartition(bytes32,address)":{"details":"Remove the right of the operator address to be an operator on a given partition for 'msg.sender' and to transfer and redeem tokens on its behalf.","params":{"operator":"Address to rescind as an operator on given partition for 'msg.sender'.","partition":"Name of the partition."}},"setCertificateSigner(address,bool)":{"details":"Add a certificate signer for the token.","params":{"authorized":"'true' if operator shall be accepted as certificate signer, 'false' if not.","operator":"Address to set as a certificate signer."}},"setControllers(address[])":{"details":"Set list of token controllers.","params":{"operators":"Controller addresses."}},"setDefaultPartitions(bytes32[])":{"details":"Set default partitions to transfer from. [CONTAINS THE CONDITIONAL OWNERSHIP CERTIFICATE]","to":"Token recipient.","value":"Number of tokens to transfer."}},"transferOwnership(address)":{"details":"Allows the current owner to transfer control of the contract to a newOwner.","params":{"newOwner":"The address to transfer ownership to."}},"transferWithData(address,uint256,bytes)":{"details":"Transfer the value of tokens from the address 'msg.sender' to the address 'to'.","params":{"data":"Information attached to the transfer, by the token holder. authorizeOperator(address).details: Set a third party operator address as an operator of 'msg.sender' to transfer and redeem tokens on its behalf.

params.operator: Address to set as an operator for 'msg.sender'.

authorizeOperatorByPartition(bytes32,add.details: Set 'operator' as an operator for 'msg.sender' for a given partition.

params.operator: Address to set as an operator for 'msg.sender'.

balanceOf(address).details: Get the balance of the account with address 'tokenHolder'.

params.tokenHolder: Address for which the balance is returned.

balanceOf(address).return: Amount of token held by 'tokenHolder' in the token contract.

balanceOfByPartition(bytes32,address).details: Get balance of a tokenholder for a specific partition.

params.tokenHolder: Address for which the balance is returned.

balanceOfByPartition(bytes32,address).return: Amount of token of partition 'partition' held by 'tokenHolder' in the token contract.

canOperatorTransferByPartition(bytes32,a.details: Know the reason on success or failure based on the EIP-1066 application-specific status codes.

params.data: Information attached to the transfer. [CAN CONTAIN THE DESTINATION PARTITION]
params.operatorData: Information attached to the transfer, by the operator. [CONTAINS THE CONDITIONAL OWNERSHIP CERTIFICATE]

canOperatorTransferByPartition(bytes32,a.return: ESC (Ethereum Status Code) following the EIP-1066 standard.Additional bytes32 parameter that can be used to define application specific reason codes with additional details (for example the transfer restriction rule responsible for making the transfer operation invalid).Destination partition.

canTransferByPartition(bytes32,address,u.details: Know the reason on success or failure based on the EIP-1066 application-specific status codes.

params.data: Information attached to the transfer, by the token holder. [CONTAINS THE CONDITIONAL OWNERSHIP CERTIFICATE]

canTransferByPartition(bytes32,address,u.return: ESC (Ethereum Status Code) following the EIP-1066 standard.Additional bytes32 parameter that can be used to define application specific reason codes with additional details (for example the transfer restriction rule responsible for making the transfer operation invalid).Destination partition.

certificateSigners(address).details: Get certificate signer authorization for an operator.

params.operator: Address whom to check the certificate signer authorization for.

certificateSigners(address).return: bool 'true' if operator is authorized as certificate signer, 'false' if not.

checkCount(address).details: Get number of transations already sent to this contract by the sender

params.sender: Address whom to check the counter of.

checkCount(address).return: uint256 Number of transaction already sent to this contract.

constructor.details: Initialize ERC1400 + register the contract implementation in ERC820Registry.

params.certificateSigner: Address of the off-chain service which signs the conditional ownership certificates required for token transfers, issuance, redemption (Cf. CertificateController.sol).
params.name: Name of the token.

controllers().details: Get the list of controllers as defined by the token contract.
controllers().return: List of addresses of all the controllers.

controllersByPartition(bytes32).details: Get controllers for a given partition. Function used for ERC777 and ERC20 backwards compatibility.

getDefaultPartitions(address).details: Get default partitions to transfer from. Function used for ERC777 and ERC20 backwards compatibility. For example, a security token may return the bytes32("unrestricted").

params.tokenHolder: Address for which we want to know the default partitions.

getDocument(bytes32).details: Access a document associated with the token.

params.name: Short name (represented as a bytes32) associated to the document.

getTokenDefaultPartitions().details: Get token default partitions to send from. Function used for ERC777 and ERC20 backwards compatibility. For example, a security token may return the bytes32("unrestricted").

granularity().details: Get the smallest part of the token thats not divisible.
granularity().return: The smallest non-divisible part of the token.

isControllable().details: Know if the token can be controlled by operators. If a token returns 'false' for 'isControllable()'' then it MUST always return 'false' in the future.
isControllable().return: bool 'true' if the token can still be controlled by operators, 'false' if it can't anymore.

isIssuable().details: Know if new tokens can be issued in the future.
isIssuable().return: bool 'true' if tokens can still be issued by the issuer, 'false' if they can't anymore.

isOperatorFor(address,address).details: Indicate whether the operator address is an operator of the tokenHolder address.

params.operator: Address which may be an operator of tokenHolder.
params.tokenHolder: Address of a token holder which may have the operator address as an operator.

isOperatorFor(address,address).return: 'true' if operator is an operator of 'tokenHolder' and 'false' otherwise.

isOperatorForPartition(bytes32,address,a.details: Indicate whether the operator address is an operator of the tokenHolder address for the given partition.

params.operator: Address which may be an operator of tokenHolder for the given partition.
params.tokenHolder: Address of a token holder which may have the operator address as an operator for the given partition.

isOperatorForPartition(bytes32,address,a.return: 'true' if 'operator' is an operator of 'tokenHolder' for partition 'partition' and 'false' otherwise.

isOwner().return: true if `msg.sender` is the owner of the contract.

issueByPartition(bytes32,address,uint256.details: Issue tokens from a specific partition.

params.data: Information attached to the issuance, by the issuer. [CONTAINS THE CONDITIONAL OWNERSHIP CERTIFICATE]
params.tokenHolder: Address for which we want to issue tokens.

name().details: Get the name of the token, e.g., "MyToken".

operatorRedeemByPartition(bytes32,addres.details: Redeem tokens of a specific partition.

params.operatorData: Information attached to the redemption, by the operator. [CONTAINS THE CONDITIONAL OWNERSHIP CERTIFICATE]
params.tokenHolder: Address for which we want to redeem tokens.

operatorTransferByPartition(bytes32,addr.details: Transfer tokens from a specific partition through an operator.

params.data: Information attached to the transfer. [CAN CONTAIN THE DESTINATION PARTITION]
params.operatorData: Information attached to the transfer, by the operator. [CONTAINS THE CONDITIONAL OWNERSHIP CERTIFICATE]

partitionsOf(address).details: Get partitions index of a tokenholder.

params.tokenHolder: Address for which the partitions index are returned.

redeem(uint256,bytes).details: Redeem the value of tokens from the address 'msg.sender'.

params.data: Information attached to the redemption, by the token holder. [CONTAINS THE CONDITIONAL OWNERSHIP CERTIFICATE]

redeemByPartition(bytes32,uint256,bytes).details: Redeem tokens of a specific partition.

params.data: Information attached to the redemption, by the redeemer. [CONTAINS THE CONDITIONAL OWNERSHIP CERTIFICATE]

redeemFrom(address,uint256,bytes,bytes).details: Redeem the value of tokens on behalf of the address 'from'.

params.from: Token holder whose tokens will be redeemed (or 'address(0)' to set from to 'msg.sender').
params.operatorData: Information attached to the redemption, by the operator. [CONTAINS THE CONDITIONAL OWNERSHIP CERTIFICATE]

renounceControl().details: Definitely renounce the possibility to control tokens on behalf of tokenHolders. Once set to false, '_isControllable' can never be set to 'true' again.

renounceIssuance().details: Definitely renounce the possibility to issue new tokens. Once set to false, '_isIssuable' can never be set to 'true' again.

renounceOwnership().details: Allows the current owner to relinquish control of the contract. It will not be possible to call the functions with the `onlyOwner` modifier anymore.

revokeOperator(address).details: Remove the right of the operator address to be an operator for 'msg.sender' and to transfer and redeem tokens on its behalf.

params.operator: Address to rescind as an operator for 'msg.sender'.

revokeOperatorByPartition(bytes32,addres.details: Remove the right of the operator address to be an operator on a given partition for 'msg.sender' and to transfer and redeem tokens on its behalf.

params.operator: Address to rescind as an operator on given partition for 'msg.sender'.

setCertificateSigner(address,bool).details: Add a certificate signer for the token.

params.authorized: 'true' if operator shall be accepted as certificate signer, 'false' if not.
params.operator: Address to set as a certificate signer.

setDefaultPartitions(bytes32[]).details: Set default partitions to transfer from. Function used for ERC777 and ERC20 backwards compatibility.

params.partitions: partitions to use by default when not specified.

setDocument(bytes32,string,bytes32).details: Associate a document with the token.

params.name: Short name (represented as a bytes32) associated to the document.

setPartitionControllers(bytes32,address[.details: Set list of token partition controllers.

setTokenDefaultPartitions(bytes32[]).details: Set token default partitions to send from. Function used for ERC777 and ERC20 backwards compatibility.

params.defaultPartitions: Partitions to use by default when not specified.

symbol().details: Get the symbol of the token, e.g., "MYT".

totalSupply().details: Get the total number of issued tokens.
totalSupply().return: Total supply of tokens currently in circulation.

transferByPartition(bytes32,address,uint.details: Transfer tokens from a specific partition.

params.data: Information attached to the transfer, by the token holder. [CONTAINS THE CONDITIONAL OWNERSHIP CERTIFICATE]

transferFromWithData(address,address,uin.details: Transfer the value of tokens on behalf of the address from to the address to.

params.data: Information attached to the transfer, and intended for the token holder ('from'). [CAN CONTAIN THE DESTINATION PARTITION]
params.from: Token holder (or 'address(0)'' to set from to 'msg.sender').
params.operatorData: Information attached to the transfer by the operator. [CONTAINS THE CONDITIONAL OWNERSHIP CERTIFICATE]

transferOwnership(address).details: Allows the current owner to transfer control of the contract to a newOwner.

params.newOwner: The address to transfer ownership to.

transferWithData(address,uint256,bytes).details: Transfer the value of tokens from the address 'msg.sender' to the address 'to'.

params.data: Information attached to the transfer, by the token holder. [CONTAINS THE CONDITIONAL OWNERSHIP CERTIFICATE]

redeem(uint256,bytes).notice: [NOT MANDATORY FOR ERC1400 STANDARD][OVERRIDES ERC1410 METHOD]

redeemFrom(address,uint256,bytes,bytes).notice: [NOT MANDATORY FOR ERC1400 STANDARD][OVERRIDES ERC1410 METHOD]

renounceOwnership().notice: Renouncing ownership will leave the contract without an owner, thereby removing any functionality that is only available to the owner.

transferFromWithData(address,address,uin.notice: [NOT MANDATORY FOR ERC1410 STANDARD][OVERRIDES ERC777 METHOD]

transferWithData(address,uint256,bytes).notice: [NOT MANDATORY FOR ERC1410 STANDARD][OVERRIDES ERC777 METHOD]
